O2.sentence: Sustainable Development Contributions: the project has benefited neighboring communities with safe drinking water services, continuous maintenance of water services within the farm property, and has benefited over 1,500 individuals; it has created full‑time and seasonal employment opportunities, employing 392 people, including 14 women (368 permanent, 24 seasonal), and has created more than 300 annual jobs; the project has avoided or removed tons of greenhouse gas emissions—during the monitoring period it achieved the removal of 121,707.49 tons of CO₂, and over the project lifetime it plans to remove 3.9 million tons of CO₂ over 42 years, with 394,784 tCO₂ removed to date; it has conserved 103 hectares of natural area within farm properties, keeping it as natural forest during the monitoring period, and has continuously conserved up to 103 hectares within farm properties.

The project provides economic opportunities for the community, employing 392 individuals during 2016–2022 and improving local income stability. Community members support the project and communicate its benefits to others.

6. Afforestation, reforestation, and revegetation (ARR) – activities that increase carbon stocks in woody biomass (and sometimes soils) by establishing, increasing, or restoring vegetative cover through planting, sowing, or human-assisted natural regeneration of woody vegetation (VCS Program Definitions). CCB v2.0, VCS v3.0. MONITORING REPORT: CCB Version 2, VCS Version 3. Category Metric: Achievements during Monitoring Period. Achievements during the Project Lifetime: Number of hectares of existing production forest land in which IFM7 practices have occurred as a result of the project’s activities, measured against the without-project scenario. Number of hectares of non-forest land in which improved land management has occurred as a result of the project’s activities, measured against the without-project scenario. Total number of community members who have improved skills and/or knowledge resulting from training provided as part of project activities. Number of female community members who have improved skills and/or knowledge resulting from training provided as part of project activities. > 300. 5% total employment. Total number of people employed in project activities, expressed as number of full-time employees. Number of women employed in project activities, expressed as number of full-time employees. CCB Monitoring > 300. CCB Monitoring 5% total employment. 8. Employed in project activities means people directly working on project activities in return for compensation (financial or otherwise), including employees, contracted workers, sub-contracted workers, and community members that are paid to carry out project-related work.

O3.sentence: The project has a positive impact on the surrounding population by providing long-term jobs, legal benefits, training, and health benefits.
The project ran from Year 7 to Year 36, during which natural rubber sap was tapped and new employees received training.

During the monitoring period, 121,668.49 tonnes of CO2 were removed, with plans to sequester 3,900,439 tonnes over 42 years. Additionally, female community members received training that improved their skills.

O5.sentence: The project provides environmental protection, increased employment, better economic income, permanent employment, water source protection, educational support through school internships, and donations to local communities.
Communities indirectly benefit from donations and outreach, with documentation such as invoices and letters verifying the aid provided.

The project issues and trades verified emission reductions, coordinating with a VCS approved registry. Personnel at each farm monitor and archive raw data, and the project identifies buyers and negotiates commercial terms. This generates revenue that supports project activities.

O6.sentence: Assistance with community infrastructure (such as roads) when it benefits the farm and the community. Authorized passage through the farm for low‑risk individuals who have a valid reason.

R3.sentence: Workers derive income and livelihood directly from project activities and are directly impacted.

The community group reported increased employment opportunities, better economic income, educational support, improved environmental protection, and enhanced infrastructure and morale through donations for local festivities, sewage, and water tank projects.
The project has improved the livelihoods of 392 women, contributing to increased income.

R4.sentence: The project has improved livelihoods for 392 people, as documented in monitoring plans and stakeholder socialization reports.

The community group reported increased employment opportunities, better economic income, educational support, improved environmental protection, and enhanced infrastructure and morale through donations for local festivities, sewage, and water tank projects.
During monitoring, 392 people improved livelihoods or income from project activities; overall, more than 300 people benefited.

I3.sentence: The project provides equal employment opportunities, increasing women's participation to 14 employees (~5%) and empowering them through training and employment. Community members support and communicate these benefits.
